intro: Adiantum aethiopicum f. variegatum, commonly known as the variegated maidenhair fern, is a cultivar of the maidenhair fern family. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that display a striking variegation of green and cream or white. The plant is native to Africa and thrives in humid, shady environments. It has finely divided, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 20–30 cm long. This ornamental fern is popular in indoor gardening due to its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
